document_title: What is dog tapeworm infection? Is it dangerous? Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Dog tapeworms are parasitic in the small intestine of infected dogs. After parasitizing the body, dog tapeworm larvae develop into adult tapeworms after about 1 month. (2)
On the skin
Dog tapeworms often cause itchy rashes, hives, etc. on the skin. However, these symptoms are often easily confused with food, chemical, and dog or cat hair allergies. Hydatid disease is very difficult to recognize by clinical signs, and can only be detected by tests and x-rays.
Go to the brain
Depending on the location of the lesion, the number of parasites and the body's immune response, the clinical manifestations of dog tapeworm infection on the nervous system will be different.
When dog tapeworms attack the brain, patients often have headaches, fatigue, dizziness, and lack of concentration at work. Patients can even suffer from memory loss, epilepsy, hemiplegia, and coma.
